intro: Eschweilera atropetiolata, commonly known as the black-stemmed zygocactus, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its dark, almost black stems and broad, leathery leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, which bloom during the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
